data.text: Simon the high priest, the son of Onias,
And by him was built from the foundation the double height,
In his days the cistern to receive water, being in compass as the sea, was covered with plates of brass:
He took care of the temple that it should not fall,
How was he honored in the midst of the people
He was as the morning star in the midst of a cloud,
As the sun shining upon the temple of the most High,
And as the flower of roses in the spring of the year,
As fire and incense in the censer,
And as a fair olive tree budding forth fruit,
When he put on the robe of honor,
When he took the portions out of the priestsâ€™ hands,
So were all the sons of Aaron in their glory,
And finishing the service at the altar,
He stretched out his hand to the cup,
Then shouted the sons of Aaron,
Then all the people together hastened,
The singers also sang praises with their voices,
And the people besought the Lord, the most High,
Then he went down, and lifted up his hands over the whole congregation of the children of Israel,
And they bowed themselves down to worship the second time,
Now therefore bless ye the God of all,
He grant us joyfulness of heart,
That he would confirm his mercy with us,
There be two manner of nations which my heart abhorreth,
They that sit upon the mountain of Samaria,
Jesus the son of Sirach of Jerusalem
Blessed is he that shall be exercised in these things:
For if he do them, he shall be strong to all things:
